thread.title: Twin Peaks' Doc Hayward and Seinfeld actor Warren Frost dies aged 91
thread.title_full: Twin Peaks' Doc Hayward and Seinfeld actor Warren Frost dies aged 91

author: Lara Martin
title: Twin Peaks' Doc Hayward and Seinfeld actor Warren Frost dies aged 91
text:
Twin Peaks' Doc Hayward and Seinfeld actor Warren Frost dies aged 91 The World War II veteran turned actor passed away after a long illness Share Warren Frost in Twin Peaks Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Twin Peaks star Warren Frost has died age 91. 
The World War II veteran turned actor was known for his portrayal of Dr Will 'Doc' Hayward in the cult '90s TV series, which was co-created by his son, Mark Frost. 
His family confirmed he passed away at his home in Middlebury, Vermont after a long illness. 
Son Mark paid tribute to him in a statement given to The Hollywood Reporter , saying: "We're saddened today to announce the passing of our dear old dad, Warren Frost. His most famous role was Twin Peak's Doc Hayward 
“From the Normandy shores on D-Day to his 50-year career on stage and screen, he remained the same humble guy from Vermont who taught us that a life devoted to telling the right kind of truths can make a real difference in the lives of others. 
“We're grateful to have shared him with the world for as long as we did." 
Frost served in the US Navy during World War II and took part in the invasion of Normandy, before returning to the US to study English. 
He enjoyed a career in teaching and stage direction,and appeared in multiple films and TV shows before getting his big Hollywood break thanks to son Mark. Frost was a World War II veteran Warren (left) had a role as Billy on lawyer drama 'Matlock' 
Frost won plaudits for his five guest performances as Mr Ross in Seinfeld, who was the father of George's fiancee Susan. 
“Everyone wanted to be on Seinfeld, and the role was a grouchy old man, and I fit right in,” he once joked. 
He also appeared in legal drama Matlock. 
The actor will be seen in the upcoming Showtime revival of Twin Peaks, after coming out of retirement to reprise his Doc Hayward role. 
Discussing his decision to retire, he told his local paper Addison Independent : “It had been a very long, long day and I walked out of the studio and said, ‘I don’t want to do this anymore.'" 
But he added: “You never want to give it up. It’s too ingrained.” Like us on Facebook
